dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Hah! Oh, please. Not this story again. Well, uh, yeah. The Sergeyev Dam, it's, like, up another four centimeters. Now at 94. Ninety-four? That's not even a meter. What's the big deal, really?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hah! Oh, please. Not this story again. Well, uh, yeah. The Sergeyev Dam, it's, like, up another four centimeters. Now at ninety four. Ninety-four? That's not even a meter. What's the big deal, really?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The water overflow at the Sergeyev Dam has risen by 4 centimeters in a day, reaching 94 centimeters

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: It's, um, preparing for a second wave, though. North Kazakhstan. The highest ever recorded there was 425 in 2024. Okay, so, last year was bad. This year isn't that bad yet, is it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, um, preparing for a second wave, though. North Kazakhstan. The highest ever recorded there was four hundred twenty five in twenty twenty four. Okay, so, last year was bad. This year isn't that bad yet, is it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: as North Kazakhstan prepares for a second wave of flooding, according to the regional akimat (local government administration). The highest recorded level was 425 centimeters in 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: The Esil River, in Petropavlovsk, uh, it rose 11 centimeters. It's at 949 now. So? Is that, like, actually critical?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The Esil River, in Petropavlovsk, uh, it rose eleven centimeters. It's at nine hundred forty nine now. So? Is that, like, actually critical?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Petropavlovsk, the Esil River rose by 11 centimeters in a day, reaching 949 centimeters.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the critical level is 960. That's when it, you know, floods the highway near the complex.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the critical level is nine hundred sixty. That's when it, you know, floods the highway near the complex.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The critical level is 960 centimeters, when water floods the highway near the Petropavlovsk hydroelectric complex.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Floods the highway? They're already restricting traffic, aren't they? Yeah, the "Petropavlovsk Bypass." Since April 1st. They've got signs and, uh, monitoring.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Floods the highway? They're already restricting traffic, aren't they? Yeah, the Petropavlovsk Bypass. Since April first. They've got signs and, uh, monitoring.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Due to rising water levels, authorities have restricted traffic on the affected road. "Flooding has covered the roadway on the annually inundated section of the 'Petropavlovsk Bypass' highway," the regional akimat stated. From 10:00 P.M. on April 1, all vehicle movement on this section has been restricted. Traffic signs, signal posts, and round-the-clock monitoring have been put in place.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Signs. Right. Because signs stop floods. That's effective. Well, they're, um, recommending alternative routes. And Kazhydromet already analyzed the risks across all regions.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Signs. Right. Because signs stop floods. That's effective. Well, they're, um, recommending alternative routes. And Kazhydromet already analyzed the risks across all regions.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The akimat has recommended alternative routes: Previously, Kazhydromet analyzed the flood risks across all regions of Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Risks? They've got 37,000 rescuers. Boats. Evacuation centers. Seems a bit much for 94 centimeters, no?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Risks? They've got thirty seven thousand rescuers. Boats. Evacuation centers. Seems a bit much for ninety four centimeters, no?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan prepares for floods: 37,000 rescuers, boats, and evacuation centers

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: It's, you know, about being prepared for the second wave. Or, like, total overreaction. They're just, uh, being cautious.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, you know, about being prepared for the second wave. Or, like, total overreaction. They're just, uh, being cautious.
